contentrichtext.text: {{for|the college football all-star game|East–West Shrine Game}} The '''Shrine Bowl''' was a former postseason [[college football]] bowl game. The first game was played on December 18, 1948, at [[War Memorial Stadium (Arkansas)|War Memorial Stadium]] in [[Little Rock, Arkansas]] between [[Hardin-Simmons University]] and [[Ouachita Baptist University|Ouachita Baptist College]].<ref>Foldesy, Jody. "Bowls burgeon as big business", ''The Washington Times''. December 21, 1997. Page A1.</ref> The 1949 edition was held in Carbondale, Illinois as the [[Indiana State Sycamores football|Indiana State]] Sycamores faced the Salukies of Southern Illinois University. ==Game result== {| class="wikitable" !
